intro: Siler, commonly known as blueweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are perennial herbs characterized by their slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Siler species are native to temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North America. They are often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
